Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable and Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: seachelleRogers
Reviews.Content: Got a room at the Honeysuckle Inn Branson, 8-23-12. The lady that checked us in was so nice and helpful. She honored the internet rate I had pulled up on my phone. Also upgraded us to a bigger King with a sofa. We had stayed here a few years ago, glad we came back to it. The only thing that we were disappointed with was the breakfast buffet. Not hardly anything at all on it. Biscuits w gravy, both not very hot and almost gone, cereal, bread laid out for toast. I saw a couple come in and walk out immediately b/c they said they were out of waffle batter. They weren't happy. Also didn't have a single pastry. Few more items but nothing at all like we usually get when there is a full hot breakfast offered. Never saw an attendant to help and restock the breakfast. We would return again because the location of the Inn, and the customer service in the office is superb. The hotel also had a prayer request card in the room, which I thought was awesome. They gather them and get together weekly to pray. Almost forgot, the property is very well maintained and the 2 pools looked nice and clean and one of them was much bigger than normal. Wish I would have had time to take a dip, they looked so good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: greentigercat
Reviews.Content: Had read good reviews so had high hopes. First, our reservations were messed up. The breakfast was not as expected. Biscuits and gravy (no sausage gravy guys) and waffles you had to stand in line for. A toaster and cereal of course. The inside pool was cold. We didn't even get into it all the way and changed our minds. Only one hot tub with a hotel with 500(?) rooms? Was close to a lot of shops and restaurants Overall, will look for a smaller hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good last minute stay.”
Reviews.Author: topolka
Reviews.Content: We decided to take our kids to Branson for the weekend at the last minute and didn't have reservations. We stopped in at the Honeysuckle Inn because of its great location to the strip and Silver Dollar City. I was suprised to find that we recieved a great discount because we are season ticket holders to SDC. The rooms are bigger then most rooms on the strip and have two queen beds with upscale bedding and down comforters. We all enjoyed the pool the first evening. Our kids loved that it is right next door to the Imax which is a must for us when in Branson. We will stay definantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kjs686s
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Honeysuckle Inn with my mom and sister on several occasions. Overall, the location is nice, the pool and breakfast are more than up to par and the staff is friendly. Adjoining rooms have been nice for us since we usually travel with up to 4 people and enjoy having our own beds. The rooms are clean and the beds for the most part are comfortable. I will say that as a hotel that markets itself as a conference center, the internet/wireless service is lacking. Sometimes it would work just fine, other times not at all. This seemed to be the consensus around Branson, so it's possibly out of their control. The hotel is easily accessible and close to many popular Branson attractions. We have enjoyed walking over to Little Hacienda for a Mexican fix of food and margaritas without having to drive. I will say that this past time, I saw two spiders in the room. I know it's common especially with the warmer winters and unseasonably hot spring/summer, but ONE of them was a Brown Recluse. It was in the bathroom sink and I was unable to sleep the rest of that night! The breakfast is very good, although I wish they did offer a basket of fresh fruit. Overall though, the facilities, amenities, location and staff are very nice. I would still return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice all around and great rate”
Reviews.Author: lonitay
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel but very well kept, clean, nice furnishings, simply cozy will def be back and will recommend to family and friends. Great price and a discount if you hold a season pass to Silver Dollar City park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: richierich1962
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Honeysuckle Inn for a few days. I got a great deal through a travel site and it was $45 a night. Things were very slow there, and all over town. The room was very comfortable, the kids enjoyed the pool and I enjoyed the hot tub. The free breakfast was decent with make your own waffles, bisquits and gravy, and cereals. For free it was decent and filling to start our day. The location was close to everything on the strip without a lot of traffic to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Honeysuckle sucks”
Reviews.Author: Louis L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Honeysuckle over the weekend. The room was ok at best. The breakfast really torqued me off. They have cereal and toast that come with the room, but if you want a donut you have to pay. THE WHOLE IDEA OF A CONTENTINAL BREAKFAST IS SO YOU DON'T HAVE TO BUY BREAKFAST!! YOU PEOPLE TOTALLY MISS THE POINT!! I'm pretty sure every other hotel in Branson will provide you with a donut, but not this place. And Ice. They guard the ice machine like it was full of gold. Signs all over the place "Do not fill your cooler from ice machine", well you don't have to worry about filling your cooler, because you can't get enough ice to fill a soda cup out of their machines. The cable tv was VERY limited. I wanted to watch the History channel, not to be found. Or the vacation channel, not to be found. The room was very plain and bed was well worn. I kept my shoes on because I did not want to walk on the carpet. 152 hotels in Branson, pick another one!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed on this stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jayhawkfan51
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with the lack of details here. We were only able to swim 1 out of 4 days of our stay because they had to "shock" it. To me when you advertise a pool hours as 9-midnight it should be ready to go at nine am. Not noon. I understand the need to treat pool but do it after midnight so it's available in am. We also were only informed of it's closing after we called front desk. After walking across parking lot in swimwear, finding door locked and walking back across in 40 degree temps not ideal. Could have been notified at breakfast verbally or by sign on door. No apologies were even attempted. Also FREE continental breakfast was very lacking. Bread juice cereal. And a French toast stick if you were lucky. Not even a piece of fruit in site. Obviously it was so $4 would be spent on buffet. I will say rooms and breakfast were very clean and nice. Maid service was mediocre. Interesting way to make beds. :(

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: creatv
Reviews.Content: Although the place was clean and the beds have been updated probably our biggest disappointment was the continental breakfast. We stayed 4 nights and only ate there once, mostly because it was always full with people from the buses that just come there for breakfast and then camp and visit. Also the breakfast only amounted to cereal, toast, hard boiled eggs and juice and coffee. They had another breakfast line you could go through and pay $4 for which included alot of the stuff that other hotels include in their continental breakfasts - so needless to say we won't be going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leslie C
Reviews.Content: This is the most Beautiful property I have ever stayed at!!! The service was great. Rooms were exceptionally clean. The outdoor pool was huge and very clean. They also have an indoor pool and hot tub. Breakfast is plentiful and good. Great value for the price. Will stay at Honeysuckle Inn every time we go to Branson!

Reviews.Title: “hotel stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: barbara m
Reviews.Content: Clean and nice size rooms. Has two pools and a jacuzzi in the pool room. Very nice employees. Breakfast could have a bigger variety but overall great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not my best stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Dora D
Reviews.Content: Checked in and room had not been clean when we opened the door. Had to wait about 2 hours came back and they were just finishing. Doesn't appear the cleaning staff does the job completely.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Christian Innkeepers with hospitality to spare”
Reviews.Author: HappyApple65
Reviews.Content: Two pools, hot tub and wonderful sitting area's. Cookies in the afternoon were a delightful surprise. The rooms were clean and the grounds beautiful. All of the help was very nice and accommodating. Near many shows and Imax and not far from Silver Dollar City. Ask for internet rate.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but worth the stay...”
Reviews.Author: suehilton1
Reviews.Content: A simple and inexpensive motel. Nothing fancy, but one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed at. The only complaint I really have is the free breakfast. First of all, it ends at 9:00. We were told it was from 7 to 10 and we went in at 9:20 and they wouldn't let us eat. For people who stay up later on vacation and sleep in a little, these breakfast times arent good. But aside from that, we were very pleased with this hotel. We loved the location, just off the strip. Convenient to lots of attractions. Some of the reviews talked about this being a white trash haven but I didn't see any of that. The other guests were polite and respectable. My family would definitely stay here again if we ever go to Branson again.

Reviews.Title: “Will happily stay again”
Reviews.Author: purpleluvr
Reviews.Content: I stayed over fourth of July weekend and they were Extremely busy and short handed but tried to take care of each person's needs in stride. It is located right off of the strip and as I was visiting family members staying close to SDC, it was to jump on and off the strip. Only bottleneck was at SDC. I asked for a room with easy accessibility as I am not very mobile and they gave me a room close by as asked (I called ahead but was still surprised they could accomodate when I seen how busy they were. The pool was very well maintained and the small amenities such as cookies and tea was very appreciated. They also supply a nice breakfast and, although they prefer you to eat in cafeteria, when I again asked them to accomodate my disability, they readily agreed. Although their stress level had to be high (their phone rang constantly and I noted people continuously in and out) they always greeted me with a smile on their faces and voice. I was very pleased to stay there and they have moved to the top of my lists of places to stay while in Branson. I told them to look for my return!

Reviews.Title: “NEEDS IMPROVEMENT”
Reviews.Author: TFROMTEXAS11
Reviews.Content: The Honeysuckle Inn was ok to stay in, it was clean and had nice pools and a great location. They had a group of youth staying there and they must have jumped and wrested all night because we were kept up all night all week.The wi-fi never worked for us and we reported it often but we still couldn't get it to work for us. If you stay there make sure that you get upstairs and make sure that you don't need internet. Some of the staff seemed to be concerned with our issues but some acted like they could care less.Not the type of customer service I would like.

Reviews.Title: “We definitely will be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cjmir
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week for a family reunion. Rooms and accomodations were exactly what we needed for 50 people. Carpets in rooms need to be cleaned, but the service of the people made up for anything that may not have gone exactly right. Our flight was cancelled on the day we left. We didn't know until we tried to print our boarding pass. Janette and the rest of the people in the lobby office went over and above everything that could be expected to get us booked on another airline, get our rental car deposited in Springfield, MO instead of Branson, let us stay in our room and use the pool until well after checkout time so we could be comfortable. They were on the phone on our behalf on hold with some of the airlines for 30 minutes to an hour just trying to help us out. They were all good Christian people with hearts of gold and helping us out with a smile the entire way. Thank you, each of you, for your kindness and generosity. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for young families!”
Reviews.Author: BransonNative
Reviews.Content: We have a family with 4 small children, and this place was a dream. The property is laid out so that the parking is in the middle, so everything is very private and safe. Our kids loved both pools (they have 2 - one indoor & one outdoor) and the breakfast served right there made it easy for our family to get up and moving in the morning. I would highly recommend the Honeysuckle Inn if you have children. BTW, the front desk clerks are very friendly and helpful, which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: trsarich
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay. The rates are very good and the rooms are nice and clean. The location is perfect for Branson. The property is georgous! I recommend it to anyone. Staff was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: CKress
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay and great value. I don't know why it's not rated higher in these recommendations. The area was quiet and our room was fresh, and clean. It's a good location - not quite as busy as the main strip but not far from anything either. In fact there are several places to eat or shows to see within walking distance. The only issue is that the breakfast menu is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: RN2009
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here as we have many times before. We thought it was great when we learned they had lowered their rates since the last time we stayed. I am not sure if that is the reason why, but there were all kinds of trashy people staying here. There were kids, and I mean young children, running amuck all hours of the day/night. There were beer-drinking, trashy people with women in bikinis hanging off the balcony of their rooms and four-wheelers/motorcycles in the back of their vehicles. These people's idea of a vacation was occupying the pool ALL day. It was impossible to swim as they were diving in and being COMPLETELY inconsiderate. We did not even bother with the continental breakfast, so I can not tell you how it was. But I can tell you that the rooms were noisy, the pool was packed with people well past time it was supposed to be closed, the laundry room did not lock, and the housekeeping was poor. Also, every night about 6, when we were showering and getting ready to go see a show, the power went off. It was inconvenient and nearly caused us to be late. This used to be a great place to stay, but I surely would not ever stay here again - unless they raise the rates to keep riff-raff out

Reviews.Title: “White trash haven”
Reviews.Author: kstravelinwoman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the honeysuckle for many years. They have always had higher than average prices. However, just very recently they have lowered them to compete with other hotels (50$ a night or so). This has allowed white trash and riffraff to come to the hotel. They spend all day in the pool. When we got in, they threw balls at our heads, dived in on top of us, and made snide remarks. I guess they thought they owned the pool. They stayed in until midnight, at which time they were good and drunk and loud. I won't stay here again. I'd rather pay 100$ a night to stay with good people than half that and fight the drunken hostile riffraff. Also, the power went out twice, both times right at dinner/show time. It was over 100 degrees outside and no AC!! Honeysuckle, RAISE YOUR PRICES AGAIN! You don't want to end up like the Georgetown or the Blue Bayou. --32 year Branson veteran

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: fairydust_01
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location, very close to "the strip." Our daughter enjoyed the large outdoor swimming pool. Also has an indoor pool and hot tub, which we did not use. They had a fair continental breakfast with biscuits and gravy, waffles, toast, and cereal. The room itself was clean, but beds were pretty uncomfortable and squeaky. Also, the shampoo/soap they gave was very cheap. For the lower price, it was a satisfactory hotel for our weekend in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: jwf9320
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in July 2010. It was perfect for the money we spent and a great deal at that! One outdoor pool and an indoor pool with a jacuzzi was available and open until midnight. Room was very clean. Service very good. Another plus was the landscape of the complex. Very beautiful! Even had an outdoor garden pond with goldfish. The owner and his staff have obviously put a lot of work into the hotel. Breakfast was very good as well. Consisted of bisquits and gravy, waffles, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: J_me201063
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay! Nice jacuzzi room, friendly staff, very comfortable queen bed, good location, and a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: happydewitt-arkansas
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Staff. Comfortable Beds . Good Breakfast.. Our only disapointment was hot tub. not even half of jets working and the ones that did work were only half working. We always make sure our hotels have hot tubs, for evening relaxation before bedtime. This was the worse we have ever seen. We recommend if you are not interested in working hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, friendly staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Enjw
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 4 night stay at this place. We were in Branson with a large youth group,(around 55 all together.) The staff were all nice, the indoor and outdoor pools were very clean and the breakfast room was large enough to accomidate all of us. The breakfast was decent but not the best, but as free food it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmccowan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed last October. Hotel is just off the strip. It is a great location. The staff are real nice. Room was clean. We stayed in room 106 with a jacuzzi. The breakfast was good. Waffles are great. They have great vacation packages. Check there web site. So enjoy Branson. You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Motel”
Reviews.Author: rmr3599
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times. Prices are on the edge of what we are willing to pay for a room so I look on the internet and if the rates are down we stay here. The rooms are comfortable and their breakfast is good. The Motel is located on one of the bypass routes so it's easily driven to. The staff is friendly and while I consider rates a bit high if you keep a watch on them they can be reasonable at times.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: bwelliver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the Shepard Of The Hills Expressway right off of Highway 76. The hotel allows easy access to both main highways for easy driving to shows and attractions. The hotel staff was just great and the service is outstanding. Fresh cookies and coffee in the lobby are an added treat. The cookies were fabulous! The female desk clerk when we checked in was the nicest person and the female staff person when we checked out was also very nice. Easy check-in and checkout! In our reservation request we requested a lower floor room near the pool and we got just what we asked for. Our room was right near the pool and breakfast area, which was awesome. The room was a double queen, which was fine for us. It was clean and ready to go upon our early arrival. This hotel in just fine if you need a good, reasonable, and clean place to stay in Branson. The rooms do not have refrigerator or microwaves although there is a microwave available in the guest laundry room if needed. The bathroom area was just fine and we had plenty of hot water, which was awesome! We didn’t use the maid service except to get more bath towels for the second day. The maid was very nice and gave me anything I requested. We paid about $60.00 per night total, which I thought was super reasonable for this area! The outdoor pool was closed but it looked big and nice. The indoor pool and hot tub was clean and the water in the pool was comfortable to me. I swam alone both days I was there and that was nice. The continental breakfast was fine if you are not too picky. There was cereal, juice, toast, biscuits and gravy, and waffles. You could make your own waffle, which was cool. The food was fine for us and was plenty if you don’t eat a huge breakfast. The lady working the breakfast was really nice. One note: There is no tip jar for some reason but they will accept tips so do the right thing and leave a little something for the staff! Overall I would say if you need a decent priced place to stay this could be good for you! I would defiantly use this hotel again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “So-So Place”
Reviews.Author: MSST84
Reviews.Content: Room clean, linens clean, carpet sticky feeling under feet, toilet flushed slow then became clogged, bed was comfortable, access to room was kind of hard and inconvienient. The breakfast was mediocre with watery gravy for the biscuits and watery orange juice plus there was a group of kids in sequined garments who interupted everyone's eating to sing and then try to sell CD's of themselves. The front desk help while nice enough were very slow in handling the four guests ahead of me, had to wait almost a half hour to do just check in. The pools were the best part of the stay, clean and inviting, definately a plus. While not the worst place , could have been much better, and with all the places to stay in Branson we will likely stay somewhere else next trip.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better...to put it politely”
Reviews.Author: LiuMeien
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel 2 times, the first time was a year ago and I was happy with the service, so I decided to come back. From the outside, it looks like a nice hotel. It has 2 swimming pools; an outdoor and an indoor with a hot tub. Having 2 pools is kind of nice, but the hot tub didn't look too....well, hot (pun intended). It was old and looked like it needed to be cleaned. The rooms were really nasty. They had green carpet with stains all over the floor and there were water stains all over the chair and dresser like there might have been a leak somewhere. Then there was the smell....it was bad, but after a while you got to where you didn't notice it as much. The smell made me wonder what was one the bed. We just grabbed the extra blankets and threw them over the bed, so we wouldn't have to actually touch....the bed. Not too comfy, but better than the alternative. With that said, there are a few good things about the hotel...from the outside it looks pretty nice, it was quiet, had friendly staff, free wifi, free cookies and coffee when you come in the lobby. Hopefully I just got a bad room.

Reviews.Title: “A reat place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: givethanks53
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Branson for 22 years and have not missed a one year! We have stayed at other hotels but about 5 years ago we started staying at the Honeysuckle Inn. We have brought family young and old with us and they always want to go back to Honeysuckle Inn. It feels like home and they make you feel like you are at home. The rooms are clean, the pool is clean, and the breakfast is pretty good. The staff has always been polite and our check in has been smooth. I recommend this place for young, middle age and old. Have a family reunion, they love it! Thanks Honeysuckle for making my family happy! LR

Reviews.Title: “Will use this motel again!”
Reviews.Author: garywbii
Reviews.Content: The couple in the office at check-in and check-out were extremely nice and very helpful. The rooms were standard, nothing special about them but very clean and comfortable. Had problems with the keys for the doors, as we had 2 rooms - don't mix them up or they reset and you have to get new keys made! The laundry was about the only thing I really wasn't pleased with- only 2 washers and dryers to share with other tenants that were coin operated and it took $10 and 4 hours to run the dryer until the clothes were dry. The indoor pool and jaccuzzi were very nice and the pool was bath water warm, making it more enjoyable for the kids to splash around in. The breakfast was nice - cereal, biscuits and gravy, hot belgian waffles, fresh fruit, oatmeal, milk, juice, and coffee. Also, there was always hot coffee and fresh cookies to snag in the lounge. We didn't make use of the outdoor pool as they had just filled it Memorial Day weekend so I don't have an opinion about that. The grounds were well kept and clean and the maid service was prompt every day. There is free WiFi but it was extremely slow - we couldn't really use it on our laptop, it took to long to open internet explorer. The location is perfect!! Just off the main strip, it's right across from IHOP, IMAX, Golden Corral and a gas station, traffic was lighter there and it was easy to get in and out. We will use this motel again!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best.....”
Reviews.Author: NWTravelerMissouri
Reviews.Content: The hotel (motel) looks much better on the outside. The rooms are small and not the cleanest. The indoor poor was fair and the hottub was way too hot to use. The breakfast was good and rates were decent (make sure you ask for the internet discount). We will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Babs2709
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I'm usually a hotel snob but since Branson doesn't have a lot of high end hotels and we were looking to save money we thought we'd try the Honeysuckle Inn. What a pleasant surprise! Normally I would never stay at a "motel" with outside doors but since Branson is such a safe and family friendly town I thought it would be okay. Not only was check in a breeze with two very nice gentlemen taking care of me, the room was as clean as a pin! Don't get me wrong....this is no luxury hotel here but if you are looking for a safe, very clean, and cost effective hotel in a great location this is it! The beds were comfortable and the staff was very nice. The indoor pool was nice but a bit small once it got full of kids. The free breakfast was adequate and there is also a "pay for it" breakfast option which was $6 for adults and $4 for kids. I did not think it was worth the $6 so I went with the free continental breakfast on day two. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time”
Reviews.Author: kllovesal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three days. We had a great time. The rooms where clean and quite. The kids 10 and 9 years-old loved the pools. We are already planing another trip next year and will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A great little place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: katieannlaw
Reviews.Content: My boyfriends brother lives in Branson and was getting married so both he and myself and 11 others flew out from England for the wedding. The brides family had sorted out in advance that we would stay in The Honeysuckle Inn. When we arrived it was about 11pm and the man on the desk did take quite some time to process our payments for the rooms and seemed to get quite confused but we were just happy to finally be there after such a long flight (16 hrs!) I am pleased to say that our rooms and bathroom were very clean and tidy (something I was worried about after reading some of the above reviews before I left) I particularly enjoyed the power shower and the hairdryer was great! There was a note you could leave on your bed if you wished your sheets to be changed and a magazine about things you could do on your trip. Every day we had fresh clean towels delivered and our bins emptied. The pool was fab! It was really good weather and was just what I needed after a day in the sun! All in all, I couldnt fault the hotel and would definitely stay there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: flynomore
Reviews.Content: About on par with a decent Days Inn. Cheap furniture and a cheezy attempt at looking quaint with lace curtains and colored sheets. Rates were decent for the midweek off season time that we were there. The most frustrasting thing was that the internet was down for the full 2 days we were there. I repeatedly called and visited the office to be repeatedly told it will be just a little longer until it's fixed. Since I have to work while away from the office I had to go across the street and use the internet at the Comfort Inn. Morning Continental breafast which was included consisted of ONLY coffee, juice and 3 types of dry cereal. If you wanted anything more it was available but for extra cost. The breakfast room resembled a sterile cafeteria at an old folks home, but then I think that's the customer base at this place.

Reviews.Title: “We will not be returning here!!!”
Reviews.Author: NikNik86
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided on a last minute trip to Branson. Having been to the city numerous times we decided to stay at the Honeysuckle Inn because of the cute exterior and location of the property. That is ABSOLUTELY all this hotel has going for them. I called and made reservations over the phone. The lady I spoke with didn't say anything about check in times. We arrived around 9 AM and were promptly told that we were "very early." The woman at the check in desk felt it necessary to state that over and over again. We got into our room and found it to be mediocre at best. The beds were uncomfortable and the bathroom was tiny. To top off our vacation, on our last evening there, my husband had to kill a large black widow spider that was crawling across the bathroom door (and yes we are sure that it was a black widow). He called the front desk to tell them and the lady that answered didn't seem to be concerned or surprised with the information. We will be returning to Branson......but will definitely not be staying at the Honeysuckle or recommending it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kd11783
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made a last minute decision to go to Branson for the weekend. We basically jumped in the car and left so I didn't have time to make a hotel reservation on-line. After a full day at Silver Dollar City we were ready to find a room. The HoneySuckle Inn was in a great location and the property was well kept.. We went in the office and the friendly staff gave us a room (king bed) for about $60. The room was clean, great air conditioning, hair dryer, etc...My only complaints were that the sheets were pretty worn and window could have had better drapes or something to make it darker. Over all great stay, especially for the price and lack of reservation

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: msbecaroo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 615 in April 2007. The room was clean. There was a single-cup coffee maker that we didn't use. There was a blow dryer that worked surprisingly well, and great water pressure in the shower( a major plus for me.) The only complaints about the room would be the mini-blinds on the window and a few of the pillows were lumpy. I will mention there was a group of seniors there, so we were the only family with children. The entire place was quiet as a mouse and we always had the indoor pool/hot tub to ourselves. The hot tub was nice, and HOT!! The pool was small but the kids didn't mind since they were the only ones in it. I also feel the need to mention, that while we were at the pool, my daughter pre-flushed the toilet since it had toilet paper in it, and it overflowed onto the floor. I called the front desk and after about 30 minutes, they plunged it but DID NOT mop up the floor...so DON'T FORGET YOUR WATER SHOES!!! If you plan to use the indoor pool during cold weather, ask for a room that is close. It's a long walk in the cold rain. Last but not least, the free breakfast, as well as the $5.00 buffet left much to be desired, but it got us through. Overall, it was decent for the price,(66.96) and the location is very close to a lot of attractions. I would probably stay there again. Rebecca in St. Louis

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in Customer Service Skills”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravell
Reviews.Content: Acutually I just got off the phone with the General Manager at Honeysuckle Inn and was given the biggest run around. So I will just start at the beginning. This is the second time we stayed there at the Inn. The first time we stayed there was last year and it was uneventful, but when you are visiting Branson, the only time you spend in your room is to shower and sleep. This trip we planned to stay around the pool alot more. The rooms were not clean, and the breakfast buffet was disgusting. My three teen agers would not eat anything. So we did not go back. Here's where the problem really started. My daughter left something behind in the room and when we got back home we noticed an immediately called the Inn. The person answering the phone said that they would be glad to ship it to us and that they would bill my credit card. When I asked if I could give him the CC number, he said no that he had all the information since I had just checked out that morning. Well, the idiot did not use the card that I had paid my bill with, rather they used the one I had used the previous year. Therefore, overdrawing my account, when I called Honeysuckle they said they did not update their information concerning Credit Cards and pretty much it was my problem. I told her that it was because of her unempt clerk not taking the time to get the information, it was costing me. I also informed her that I would never stay there and I would let everyone I know not to stay there. They need a lesson in Customer Service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter pulled back the bed covers immediately upon our arrival and found several black hairs on the sheet! The sheet had some old stains also. (Luckily, my daughter had been wise enough to bring her own comforter and pillow from home). The room didn't smell fresh. We decided to check out the bathroom to see if it was clean. It appeared clean, but toilet would not flush. Called front desk, and they promptly sent someone out with a plunger. We found no iron/board in our room, so assumed we could just call front desk and have one brought to our room. Not so. We had to haul our clothes to the laundry room some distance from our room to be able to iron. The carpet in our room had several bad spots and just felt yucky underfoot. The ice machine and Coke machine were directly outside our window and were noisy throughout the night. There was no weatherstrip along the bottom edge of the front door of our room and about an inch of daylight could be seen (?). We passed on swimming in their indoor pool. All this for a total of $70 (tax included) per night! We will not stay at the Honeysuckle in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Honeysuckle”
Reviews.Author: jdkizer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honeysuckle using the three night package and could not have been more pleased. The seats at the shows we picked were great ( Shoji, 70's ) we rode the Ducks went to the Imax too. Staff was helpful with directions and questions, room was big and clean but small sink area. Pool was ice cold swam inside instead, large hottub, good breakfast buffet. Hotel is in great location close to hwy 76 but not on it. Breakfast buffets should open earlier for people who leave before 7:00 am. We will stay there next time we go to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to rest”
Reviews.Author: olaydt
Reviews.Content: We were tired of being on the road. Saw this lovely motel and decided to spend the night. We were not disappointed. Room was clean, cool and quiet, beds were comfortable. We didn't hear any highway noise altho the motel is just off the highway. The clerk and staff were exceedingly pleasant and helpful. After eating in a small restaurant we returned to the motel & sat on the wooden swing and chairs on their covered porch. We watched the Memorial Day traffic pass by and enjoyed our coffee and the cool breeze. It was such a peaceful atmosphere which helped us to relax after a day of long road miles.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better choices in Branson.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed on the first floor July 31 to August 1. Our carpets had not been swept clean nor was the bathroom floor clean. The tub looked dirty, also. There was a piece of popcorn on one of the chairs and it stayed there the entire time! Housekeeping never did pick it up and it was very noticeable. Also the coffee pot was not washed each day nor was the filter thrown out. The first night it sounded as if a family of elephants were overhead, but the noise settled down about 10:30. The next two nights were quiet. The light-filtering blinds were too light-filtering. Need to have a draw drape across them. The free breakfast was nothing special and the $5.00 breakfast buffet was mediocre. The pool was nice and the grounds are very lovely. The location is good.

Reviews.Title: “It was an okay stay”
Reviews.Author: tekgnm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honeysuckle Inn August 9 - August 13. I found an internet coupon for a free breakfast buffet every morning of our stay. The first thing I can say is that the staff was extremely friendly. I called them a few times prior to our trip to double check things and make some special requests. Not once did they seem tired of hearing from me. The location is good. It is very close to the strip (and Celebration City) but away from the strip. The Imax Theater is right next door as is Ray Stevens' place. It has a quaint cozy appeal when you approach the parking lot. Our room was 558, a non-smoking first floor room located by the outdoor pool. We had requested a crib and I was suprised to find it to be a full size crib instead of a playpen. The room was very spacious, but I cannot say the same for the vanity. We (4 of us) had a difficult time putting all our toiletries on the limited space provided. We wound up moving the coffee maker and ice bucket to add space. We managed. My chief complaint was our bathroom. The tub seemed to be dirty which made me cautious about giving our 1 year old a tub bath. I also noted there was a very large yellow discoloration ring on the linoleum. I am guessing it was only due to wet towels lying there for a lengthy time. The shampoo is in "packets" rather than plastic bottles. Make sure you open prior to shower or you may never get it open. We never noticed any noise, but we are typically the ones making the noise rather than on the hearing side. The blinds they use on the windows - beware- are light filtering. It wasn't a bother to us, but for people who need darkness to rest.... Other than this, our room was clean, spacious, and satisfactory overall. They only offer a breakfast buffet in way of food and not for late risers. The buffet stops serving at 9:30. It will cost you approx. $5.00 per adult and $2.00 per child. The offerings were coffee/juice/milk, canned fruit cocktail, tomato slices, some fresh friut, french toast sticks, bacon, scrambled eggs, ham, smoked sausage, sausage links, potatoes, cereals, donuts, toast, and english muffins. The scrambled eggs and canned fruit were the least satisfactory. The cereals were generic brands and the donuts were "okay". The rest of the breakfast was on the good side. I believe the continental breakfast comes free of charge. Both of the pools were clean and being used frequently. Parking was easy. My children enjoyed walking around the grounds and watching the fish in the pond. All of the entrances are outside, so there is no elevator. Average accommodations with great service and good location.

HotelInfo.Name: Honeysuckle Inn and Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 3598 Sheperd Of The Hills Expressway, Branson, MO 65616
